detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
If Workday indicates you do not meet the CPSC 425 prerequisites, but you have taken CPSC 221 one of [MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, and MATH 253] and one of [MATH 152, MATH 221, and MATH 223], then you may submit a Request for Registration Assistance Form as described at:
https://www.cs.ubc.ca/students/undergrad/courses-deadlines/cpsc-appeals-steps-undergraduate-students.

Please ensure that you include in your message exactly what courses that you have taken meet the MATH requirements and which section(s) of CPSC 425 you are interested in, in priority order. Requests that do not follow these guidelines may be denied without consideration.

If your request is approved, we will either grant you permission to register yourself (if your registration date has not yet arrived), register you for a lecture section (if it has and a seat is available), or otherwise: waitlist you with an effective waitlist date no later than the next business day after the date your request for registration assistance included complete information.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
The prerequisite for this course is: CPSC 310, CPSC 313, and CPSC 317.

In addition, CPSC 436A requires oral examinations of course work on a regular basis and in-person during the Monday 1-4PM lab period. By end-of-day Tuesday Sep 17, 2024, students must complete a scheduling survey with the course staff. Any who are unable to schedule their oral examination time will be denied permission to take the course and have their registration removed.

Within the Monday 1-4PM period, we do expect flexibility to accommodate students’ scheduling constraints as long as they have at least one contiguous 30-minute slot available. Most oral examinations will be conducted in groups. It is student responsibility to join a group with a compatible schedule. The oral examinations are a central element of this course, and no accommodation can be made.

Permission of the department to register is automatically granted if you meet the prerequisite listed above. Please do not request permission.

It is possible to receive credit for up to two CPSC 436 offerings that are different courses, i.e., those with different letters after the 436 number. Students may not receive credit for the same CPSC 436 offering more than once. Similarly, if a CPSC 436 offering later transitions to a regular course number, students may not receive credit for that offering and the subsequent course. Students wishing to receive credit for more than two CPSC 436 offerings must appeal for permission.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
The prerequisite for this course is all of: (a) CPSC 203 or CPSC 210, and (b) CPSC 304 or 368. 
(Note: the previous prerequisite for CPSC 330 or CPSC 340 has been removed effective as of 2024W (Sep 2024-Apr 2025).)

Permission of the department to register is automatically granted if you meet the prerequisite listed above. Please do not request permission.

It is possible to receive credit for up to two CPSC 436 offerings that are different courses, i.e., those with different letters after the 436 number. Students may not receive credit for the same CPSC 436 offering more than once. Similarly, if a CPSC 436 offering later transitions to a regular course number, students may not receive credit for that offering and the subsequent course. Students wishing to receive credit for more than two CPSC 436 offerings must appeal for permission

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
The prerequisites for this course are:
(a) CPSC 340, or (b) both CPSC 330 AND one of STAT 200, STAT 241, STAT 302, or any course credit-excluded with one of these STAT courses in the UBC Science Credit Exclusion list.

Permission of the department to register is automatically granted if you meet the prerequisites listed above. Please do not request permission.

It is possible to receive credit for up to two CPSC 436 offerings that are different courses, i.e., those with different letters after the 436 number. Students may not receive credit for the same CPSC 436 offering more than once. Similarly, if a CPSC 436 offering later transitions to a regular course number, students may not receive credit for that offering and the subsequent course. Students wishing to receive credit for more than two CPSC 436 offerings must appeal for permission

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
The prerequisite for this course is: Both of (a) one of CPSC 203, CPSC 221, and (b) one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

Permission of the department to register is automatically granted if you meet the prerequisite listed above. Please do not request permission.

It is possible to receive credit for up to two CPSC 436 offerings that are different courses, i.e., those with different letters after the 436 number. Students may not receive credit for the same CPSC 436 offering more than once. Similarly, if a CPSC 436 offering later transitions to a regular course number, students may not receive credit for that offering and the subsequent course. Students wishing to receive credit for more than two CPSC 436 offerings must appeal for permission

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
